title: How to Make a Paper Knife

steps.headline: Find an 8 ½ in (21.5 cm) by 11 in (28 cm) sheet of printer paper.
steps.description: Ordinary printer paper will do. Notebook paper is too thin for this object.

steps.headline: Fold the top right corner over to the left edge of the paper.
steps.description: Do it so the top edge of the paper lines up with the left edge of the paper. The folded portion will form a triangle, with a rectangular piece remaining along the bottom. Make sure the edges line up and that you run your fingers along the crease you've created.

steps.headline: Cut the rectangular shape from the bottom.
steps.description: Use a pair of scissors to cut the rectangular shape that is left over on the bottom of the paper. Then unfold the triangle to reveal a square-shaped piece of paper. You will use this paper to make a blade for your knife.

steps.headline: Fold the paper lengthwise at least 3-4 times.
steps.description: This will create a blade that is at least 1- 2 inches (2.5-5 cm) thick. The paper should now look like a stick.

steps.headline: Cut a slanting edge on one end of the paper.
steps.description: Cut a slanting edge on one end of the paper that makes the paper resemble a sharp kitchen knife.

steps.headline: Staple the blade together.
steps.description: Just staple the blade in the center and at the top edge to hold it together. You can even color the staples with white-out if you'd like to hide them more.

steps.headline: Make the handle from the remaining paper.
steps.description: The handle should be about 1 inch (2.5 cm) longer than the slanted part of the blade. Measure and cut the excess paper from Step 3 to the appropriate length, and then fold it to the width you prefer for your handle.

steps.headline: Staple the blade and the handle together.
steps.description: Just cross the handle over the blade, about 2 inches (5 cm) away from the flat end of the blade. Then, staple the two together at the point where they intersect.

steps.headline: Enjoy your paper knife.
steps.description: You can paint your knife silver, decorate it, or make more paper knives to keep it company.
